sub_title: Financial reporting & tax compliance at Uber | Ex-EY
summary:
■ CGA, CPA (Canada) and ACCA (UK) qualified accountant with over 11+ years of professional experience gained in the field of financial, statutory and tax reporting and compliance in the Netherlands, Saudi Arabia and Bahrain. 
■ Currently working in the Netherlands and have previously worked and lived in the Middle East and Asia-Pacific and thus can easily adapt to changing cultures. I have the skills, ability and the will to succeed in any environment.
■ My current role at Uber revolves around controllership (tax and statutory) of our legal entities in the EMEA region
■ During my tenure at EY, I served clients in various industries such as oil & gas, energy, engineering & consulting, retail and manufacturing. 
■ Through out the years in my professional career, I have developed strong analytical and project management skills, working within challenging, deadline-driven environments and got myself comfortable working with cross-border teamwork and international business teams. 
■ I enjoy being an integral part of a team and work well under pressure.
■ Beside strong technical knowledge of financial reporting and taxation, I posses excellent business development skills and I was actively involved with the Business development plans at EY to achieve the target revenue by winning new engagements and clients.

school.name: Chartered Professional Accountants of Canada (CPA Canada)

organizations.name: Chartered Professional Accountants of Canada, Association of Chartered Certified Accountants

profile_positions.description:
This is more of a controllership role.  I help building scalable and well-controlled processes to support timely and accurate financial, statutory reporting, and ensure compliance with regional and local tax regulations. For my region, I am well versed with external financial and tax-related regulations and thus, I ensure our processes and procedures result in compliance. I also promote continuous improvement in our processes and key business inputs and help contribute in business decision making.

In my role, for several EMEA countries, I own:

• local statutory financial statements (prepared either under IFRS or local GAAP). Also, preparing/reviewing conversion files from US GAAP to local GAAP/IFRS

• the tax returns (VAT, WHT, Digital service taxes, Cross border taxes (indirect), Corporate income taxes and any other applicable local taxes/fees and payment with local tax and government authorities

• finalizing statutory audits by our local (PwC) auditors as well as any tax audits that may arise in any of my country that I look after.

• monthly/quarterly reconciliations of all tax accounts

• project management of creating new legal (local) entities, from planning until incorporation. I am also leading liquidations in EMEA and APAC region.

• Managing a team of externals (outsourced consultants as well as Uber's external employees) for my portfolio of countries.
profile_positions.title: Senior Financial reporting & tax compliance Lead (Controller) - EMEA region
Financial reporting & tax compliance specialist - Middle East and North Africa (MENA)

profile_positions.description:
Dealt with taxes of Middle East and Africa (MEA) region (including Pakistan and Turkey).
My main responsibilities included:

•	Making sure that our local entities are complying with applicable tax rules in each country we are operating in.

•	Making sure that Uber BV’s services are compliant from tax perspective and our tax structure is maintained.

•	Keeping abreast with the tax regulations of MEA region, analyzing them from Uber’s perspective and if needed, taking timely actions accordingly.

•	Reviewing strategic partnerships and marketing contracts and flagging any points that may jeopardize our tax structure in MEA countries.

•	Reviewing the new products and feature launches in MEA region and assessing the associated tax exposures.

•	Providing tax support during tax audits in MEA countries to our external advisors.

•	Actively involved in meeting key stakeholders at tax authorities and/or finance ministries to contribute in policy making activities and sharing best practices with them.

•	Reviewing and signing off the tax returns (VAT, WHT and CIT) and Financial Statements of local entities.

•	Reviewing Foreign Provision Packages (FPP) for HQs review.
profile_positions.title: International Tax Specialist (Middle East and Africa region)
Senior Tax Consultant- International Taxation Services & Business Tax Compliance

profile_positions.description:
BMK is a CMA (Capital Market Authority) registered invesment bank.
During my internship there, I worked on different projects some of which were:
Preparation of customer due diligence.
Reconciliation of non-current assets for the quarter.
Preparation of Budget Forecast.
